reviews.content: I can't even start with these  people ! Tomorrow , I am going to sit and type all that happened today at this office . You won't even believe it !!  I am going to start by saying that the medical assistant introduced herself as "the nurse" . When I asked her if she was a registered nurse she said she was "a nurse" and I asked again what are your credentials and she finally said : I am a medical assistant but the nurse in the room ?!!!!!!! Her name is ASHLEY.  When I told her the illegality of the misrepresentation she got infuriated and stumped out of the room .. impersonating a nurse is a crime. And even though a medical assistant may believe what they are doing is innocent, in reality it is a crime. What they are actually doing is misrepresenting themselves and leading people to believe that they have a greater level of education and qualification than they have. Just like a physician held legally responsible for practicing medicine without a license, medical assistants that call themselves nurses can be held legally responsible for practicing nursing without a license. Depending on the laws of your state it can either be considered misdemeanor or felony. Practicing nursing without a license is always a criminal act which is punishable by the sentencing rules of the appropriate statute. It is illegal in all states to claim a license you do not have..  Tomorrow, I will tell you about the doctor . I need his name first ... you won't even believe the things he said ... by the way , he did not examine the patient ... i wonder if he is going to bill the insurance company?!!!! Go figure !

Scam. Refused to provide treatment unless I paid $125. My insurance covers 3 normal visits a year free of charge. This was  a normal doctor visit, not urgent care appointment. They even went so far as to bill my insurance company for a doctor visit when I in fact saw a nurse practitioner. They double billed me and the insurance company! Refused to reimburse me even after I proved they had a billing error. "Harry" the mythical employee that is supposed to correct the error does not return phone calls or emails. Florida Blue Insurance fraud department has been notified. Add me to the list of people scammed by this outfit.

Worse Doctors office I even been to, the rooms are disgusting, the chairs are full of stains and old, the rooms look like they came out of a horror movie. The clinic smells nasty and the female at the front is rude and careless, stay away from this place.
Hwy 98 N. Dr. today STAY AWAY!!   Rude unprofessional staff!!  Filthy offices, Grosssssss...dirty, nasty, stinks and staff are horrible!!

Went to Doctor Today in February 2017 for the Annual Wellness Exam.  They required a follow-up appointment to inform me of the results of the exam.  The insurance company pays for the annual wellness exam.  However, Doctor Today, without informing me in advance, submitted charges that I was made responsible for paying.  The insurance company informed me that had Doctor Today billed the exam as preventative, it would had been covered.  Doctor Today refused to modify the billing, leaving me responsible for paying for the exam and tests.
